title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When performing the steps to reopen a file in the Java editor by double-clicking on the file in the navigator and answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, the file is reopened quickly. However, if I repeat the same steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after double-clicking on the file in the navigator and answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after double-clicking on the file in the navigator and answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, the contents of the window should be replaced with the original almost instantly.
SR:
1. Open an edited file in the Java editor.
2. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
3. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
4. Repeat steps 1-3.
5. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
6. Observe the time it takes for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original.
